page.title: 20SWINFORD ADAPTS TO CHANGE
page.content: {Swinford}is a good example of a small rural community which is adapting to a change in the pattern of population as it becomes as much a dormitory as an agricultural village. Families who have moved to Swinford from distant parts of the United Kingdom mix with people who may be descendants of inhabitants who lived here when the first{Domesday Survey}was recorded. The village school epitomises this interdependance.{ { {As an example this survey is the {result of co-operation between the {children and staff of Swinford Church {of England School, their families and {friends.
